abstract: Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel considers raising property taxes by $500 million in 2016 in order to provide needed revenue to make larger payments on some of city's underfunded pension funds.
lead_paragraph: Chicagoans may face a significant tax increase next year as the city is required to start making larger payments to some of its underfunded pension funds.

headline.main: Illinois: Chicago Mayor Weighs Major Property Tax Increase
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Chicago Mayor Weighs Major Property Tax Increase

snippet: Chicagoans may face a significant tax increase next year as the city is required to start making larger payments to some of its underfunded pension funds.
